pros: The job environment is very laid back, fun, the staff are always there to help you increase your knowledge as a tutor, and you can work from home
cons: Can be hectic when there are a lot of students, but there are usually other tutors there to help

pros: It is a very satisfying feeling taking folks that know nothing about the industry and bringing them to a point where they are employable.
cons: Trying to stay current with construction materials.

review_title: I loved working in this department

pros: My boss was great and it was secluded which I very much enjoyed.
cons: It's hard to get a hold of other departments

pros: The staff is wonderful to work with and tutoring as a student is a great oppurtunity and experience.
cons: The pay is pretty low.

job_title: Business Office Generalist in Leesburg, FL
pros: Good for the area -- time off -- slow pace.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Leesburg, FL
pros: For the most part the advisors and staff you interact directly with are incredibly supportive people that want to help in your endeavors. The environment is relatively peaceful on a day-to-day basis.
cons: There are bureaucratic processes at play that you have little control over, and sometimes it felt like those in power didn't have much control either. The library is a public library and this may lead to occasional unruly community patrons (I've had experiences with threats of violence and patrons experiencing mental health crises in the building).

pros: Autonomy, fulfilling work, great support
cons: Calling students is awkward at first

review_title: Avoid This Institution If You Can
pros: Nothing beyond having a job that provides for your living expenses. I have to type 20 words so here they are.
cons: The administration has created a toxic culture based on fear and poor wages that does not support the growth and financial stability of its faculty and staff. The Board of Trustees should remove President Sidor and his hand picked staff immediately. They are running a once respected local institution into the ground.

job_title: Enrollment Services Assistant in Leesburg, FL
pros: The College is well organized and provides excellent training and education for students.
cons: There is a lack of work for students right now as the pandemic has reduced the amount of labor needed. This, coupled with more people taking their employment at home rather than the campus to save gas.

review_title: Dedicated faculty and staff.  Amazing students!
job_title: Dean of Students in Leesburg, FL
pros: Dedicated faculty and staff. Amazing students! A small but mighty institution.
cons: State funding limitations especially for buildings and infrastructure needs.

pros: Good benefits and paid time off.
cons: Leadership is not always fair.

pros: The wonderful people, but they don't last long.
cons: The CEO is a ruthless dictator who goes out of his way to avoid connecting with students and staff. Zero empathy. Zero leadership skills. Emails are written full of errors, literally students write more effective communications than the president. Favoritism and nepotism rampant. Promotions to high levels of management for the unprepared, unskilled, and undereducated in effective leadership and change management. But if you are cute and young, you are promoted. Senior tenured faculty have been forced out for young, cheap, and green classroom teachers. All department chairs fired in a public email by the CEO in exchange for "Deans" over an unrealistic number of content areas. One such "Dean" did not even last a year before quitting. This place is not learner centered. Not student centered. Not faculty centered. It is merely a cash cow for upper management who phone it in daily. Toxic work environment. I left an employer I used to love after 15 years of service and hard work.

pros: The staff and faculty are, for the most part, smart, collegial, and caring individuals.  Full time jobs have decent benefits.  Online classes give you some flexibility with your schedule if you are teaching.  Reasonable professional development opportunities.
cons: The salaries are some of the lowest in the state for a community college.  The tenure and promotion process is in flux, and current admin is not being proactive about addressing it or the salary issue.

pros: Busy, mostly friendly students who comply with the rules, comp time vs paid time (which can be good and bad), investment plan.
cons: Very chaotic, staff stabs you at every turn, short learning curve then systems change and another short learning curve, outsiders dictate how the office should look.

pros:
Lots of time off: 2 weeks at Christmas, no Fridays in the summer and a spring break week, plus 2-3 weeks vacation 

The students and much of the faculty and staff are great to work with.
cons:
I watched about 30 persons opt for other jobs or early retirement in just 2018 alone just to get out of there. A lot of good people were hurt by decisions from the administration.  I left with great sadness after realizing that this wasn't the same LSSC that hired me 6 years earlier. It use to be a great place to work and people loved coming in to work.

You're constantly overworked and not given the staff, resources,  leadership and autonomy you need to succeed. You're all treated as a liabilities instead of assests by an administration leadership who are looking to advance their careers from your hard work and stress and they really don't care about the college, the students or you, just themselves.  I gained 30 pounds, a nervous breakdown and a ton of gray hairs since the administration changed... and my story isn't uncommon there.  I'm just glad that I got out before it got any worse.

I felt that the administration are poor planners with decisions that added unneeded costs, stress and work on those under them. As a result I still worked via a laptop when even on a long planned vacation with my family. 

Poor communication: they will hold meetings but ignore or downplay what is said. Several people were promoted to leadership positions that they had no business being in due to inexperience with the jobs of those under them.  Meanwhile those with years of experience are being pushed out in favor of inexperienced workers who don't ask questions. 

The department heads, even HR, won't stand up for you or your work, because they're scared of the administration leadership and losing their jobs too.  So glad I got out and saved myself. I pray for those who are still there.

pros: Very professional co-workers, family feel.
cons: It’s went downhill, and very quickly since  the change in administration and the new VP/CFO took effect. Employees are not listened to, treated like they are not trustworthy and micromanaged to the point where they are fearful of losing their jobs, so they don’t dare disagree with administrators; even though these people are extremely qualified and have professionally held their positions for years and had no problems with prior administration.  Workers have abandoned their jobs by the droves in this last year alone, because of mistreatment from administration; which brings untold stress and accompanying medical conditions as the environment is so toxic with extremely poor and unqualified leadership at the helm of all that LSCC used to be. It’s extremely sad especially knowing that employees who served in the US Military and are veterans are also sadly, not immune. There is no caring about anyone underneath administrations, for the only ones the administrators care for are themselves and the advancement of their own careers, upon the blood, sweat and tears of their lowly minions.

pros: This is a truly great work environment. You will work with great people, and enjoy coming into work each day. The benefits are great, low cost health insurance, great retirement savings plan.
cons: Pay is low and it causes turnover to be very high.

pros: Friendly staff that works with your schedule. Staff that connects with others and cares about you personal life. Accommodating to your needs, supplying resources.
cons: No cons! This company made me feel comfortable and welcome at all times. I was never afraid to ask for help.

pros: If you're married to someone already working there in management it's great!
cons: You will never get a full night's restful sleep, feel good about yourself, or enjoy an acid reflux free meal while employed there.

review_title: State College now offering a four year degree!
pros: Friendly, caring environment.  Free professional development classes in fitness including yoga and zoomba. Good work life balance. Great organizational mission to provide a quality and affordable education.
cons: Pay could be improved some.

cons: The pay is low compared to other colleges.
